project_abstract.cdata: The Second Programmatic Education Sector Development Support Credit Project will assist the Ministry of Education (MoE) in undertaking the second phase of a medium-term reform agenda, aimed at addressing systemic governance issues in order to raise the quality, and cost-effectiveness of service delivery, and improve equity of access to secondary education. The reform agenda focuses on: 1) Accountability, - with reforms enforcing the establishment of institutions, and institutional mechanisms to link school subventions to objective measures of school performance. 2) Equity - through demand-side interventions to encourage rural girls' attendance at secondary schooling. 3) Administration/Capacity Building - to strengthen MoE's planning and policy making capacity, and, towards greater implementation responsibility at lower levels. 4) Monitoring, Evaluation and Dissemination - significantly emphasizing program evaluation and monitoring to guide policy and planning. Public expenditure tracking surveys and impact evaluation of programs are being undertaken. 5) Teachers' Quality -through the establishment of an autonomous Non-Government Teacher Registration and Certification Authority, responsible for the development and selection for the pre-qualification and certification of teachers. An apex institution will be responsible for the management of teacher training, and to regulate training institutions. 6) Textbook Production and Curriculum Development - through the National Curriculum and Textbook Board (NCTB), a transparent process of textbook evaluation and approval will be achieved, with the curriculum wing of NCTB being strengthened to enable its performance effectively.
